text:
“Positivity rate” for Covid tests is an important metric.

But it should not be the sole metric.

We aren’t testing a representative sample of the population. 

The people being tested are primarily those in the hospital,who have symptoms or have a reason to be tested.

They have perversity in their hearts,always plotting evil,sowing discord.

Proverbs 6:14

Progressives are not just fighting for the right things. We are prepared to take on powerful special interests. 

We know and have always known that real change never takes place without struggle. No one gives you anything. You’ve got to fight for it. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1291180031138390017/img/0qlDyPJqGUHDQUhr.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1291180031138390017/vid/480x270/BNc_tpZFooQD_AT4.mp4?tag=13

1.  ED visits;

2.  Tests numbers 

3.  Hospitalizations

4.  Deaths

Today, I'm formally introducing the RELIEF Act in Congress to help stop evictions and keep people housed during this crisis.

Few things are more essential right now than housing and running water to prevent the spread of COVID-19.

Washington Republicans understand urgency when they want their special interest friends to have more. 

But when it comes to America’s workers and children falling further into poverty, they’re dragging their feet.

55 years ago, the Voting Rights Act became law, protecting the right to vote for millions of Americans. We still have so far to go to fulfill our democracy’s promise of equal access to the ballot box. We must restore the #VRA & pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act.

I'm proud to support @VoteGloriaJ for re-election to State House District 13. She's been a champion for working families—whether she’s fighting to ensure every child has access to high-quality public education or making sure families don’t go broke paying medical bills.

As a consensus builder and community advocate, @Brandon4Tenn has proven he'll fight for health care, criminal justice reform, and an economy that works for everyone. I'm excited to stand with him in this fight to win State House District 49, and in the many fights to come.

I'm excited to support @GabbySalinas—a cancer survivor, scientist, and health care advocate dedicated to bold, inclusive reform for State House District 97. She has an incredible story of survival and resilience, and she's running to care for the community that took care of her.

It's Election Day, Tennessee! Real change starts at the local level, and I want to tell you about three incredible Democrats I’ve endorsed for the State House of Representatives.

Read up on them below ⬇️ and then find your polling place and get out there: http://IWillVote.com

Today marks one year since my constituent Brandon Lee was brutally shot in the Philippines, where he was fighting for environmental & indigenous people’s rights. On behalf of Brandon & his family, I urge the Filipino government to thoroughly investigate this disturbing crime.

55 years ago today LBJ signed the Voting Rights Act into law, which aimed to protect the right to vote for all Americans.

Yet in 2013 the Supreme Court gutted a key section of this act and McConnell is currently blocking legislation to restore it. Our work isn’t over.

Today is the 55th anniversary of the Voting Rights Act. Seven years ago, it was gutted by the Supreme Court, leading to a wave of voter suppression laws.

Our job now is to restore and expand the Voting Rights Act, fight voter suppression, and guarantee the right to vote.

Just as purveyors of misinformation are constantly testing new techniques, so should we in verifying info.

Not everything we try is going to work. Is a ban on political ads the best route? Prob not. But at least there’s a willingness to recognize how dangerous misinfo is & act.

I appreciate that Twitter is a platform that‘s at least *trying* to stop disinformation, verifying news outlets, etc.

Stopping misinformation isn’t abt sitting around for years debating ideas.

It’s about testing tactics, trying ideas, etc to find what’s effective. https://twitter.com/twittersupport/status/1291405157838684160 QT @TwitterSupport When it comes to conversations with government and state-affiliated media accounts on Twitter, we’re helping to make the experience more transparent.

We'll now use two distinct profile labels for these types of accounts, so you can easily identify them and their Tweets. (1/2) http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eev8wWmU0AATN1q.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eev9CIFVAAEXPJY.jpg

Treatment services for people with mental health or substance use disorders are more important than ever during this crisis. We need information about outbreaks at these facilities so we can direct resources to protect the health & safety of these especially vulnerable people.

I investigated COVID-19 cases at assisted living centers with @SenMarkey & @RepMaloney. Residents were 5 times more likely to test positive. Inpatient treatment facilities have similar risks, but they also don’t report their COVID-19 cases to HHS or CDC. https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/covid-19-killed-7000-assisted-living-congressional-report/story?id=71560689

We’ve seen how COVID-19 devastated nursing homes. But I’m also concerned about behavioral health & addiction treatment facilities. @RepMaloney, @RepKatiePorter & I want to know what treatment providers are doing to protect their patients & staff. https://www.warren.senate.gov/oversight/letters/warren-maloney-porter-ask-behavioral-health-and-addiction-treatment-facilities-what-actions-they-are-taking-to-protect-residents-from-covid-19-outbreaks http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eewhf5zXgAAgtw4.jpg

We need comprehensive & publicly available COVID-19 data from prisons & jails to manage this pandemic & protect the health & safety of incarcerated people, correctional staff, & the public.

The COVID-19 in Corrections Data Transparency Act requires the BOP, USMS, & state & local correctional facilities to send data weekly to the CDC on COVID-19 testing & cases for inmates & staff, & publicly report that data on their websites. Detailed demographic info is required.

COVID-19 is out of control in prisons & jails. All 10 of the largest US clusters are correctional facilities. @RepPressley, @PattyMurray, @SenBooker, @RepSylviaGarcia, @RepYvetteClarke, @RepRobinKelly & I have a bill to find out the severity of this crisis.https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/coronavirus-spreads-nations-jails-prisons-lawmakers-demand-transparency/story?id=72213761
